intro: Eschscholzia biolettii, commonly known as the biolettii poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are sturdy and upright. Eschscholzia biolettii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
